case_title: SRI VENKATESWARA LODGE vs COMMISSIONER OF INCOME-TAX, HYDERABAD, AND OTHERS
respondents: Income-tax Officer, Income-tax-cum-Wealth Tax Circle II, Hyderabad

premises_searched: Sri Venkateswara Lunch Home near Secretariat
facts.search_authorization: Issued by Commissioner of Income-tax, Hyderabad

petitioners_contentions: Search and seizure were illegal and violated Articles 14 and 19 of the Constitution.
Seizure was excessive and amounted to abuse of power.
respondents_contentions: Search and seizure were conducted in compliance with Section 132 and Rule 112.
Seized materials were relevant for assessment proceedings.
Search was not arbitrary or high-handed.

key_findings.constitutionality: Search and seizure powers under Section 132 are constitutional.
key_findings.compliance: Commissioner followed legal procedures and recorded reasons for authorization.
key_findings.specificity: Search warrant did not require specific identification of documents.
key_findings.seizure: Seizure was not arbitrary or excessive.

precedents_cited.case_name: Durga Prasad v. Superintendent (Prevention), Central Excise
Seth Brothers v. Commissioner of Income-tax
C. Venkata Reddy v. Income-tax Officer (Central) 1, Bangalore
